unnormalised: **EV Charging Scene Heating Up Like a Bollywood Blockbuster!**
normalised: **Electric Vehicle Charging Scene Heating Up Like a Bollywood Blockbuster!**

unnormalised: Hey folks, the electric vehicle (EV) revolution in India is moving faster than a Rohit Shetty car chase! Charging infrastructure, that crucial piece of the puzzle, is finally catching up.
normalised: Hey folks, the electric vehicle revolution in India is moving faster than a Rohit Shetty car chase! Charging infrastructure, that crucial piece of the puzzle, is finally catching up.

unnormalised: Tata Power just announced a massive expansion of their charging points across Maharashtra, aiming for one every 50 km on major highways. That's a big win for folks planning those Mumbai to Pune weekend getaways!
normalised: Tata Power just announced a massive expansion of their charging points across Maharashtra, aiming for one every fifty kilometer on major highways. That's a big win for folks planning those Mumbai to Pune weekend getaways!

unnormalised: Meanwhile, IIT Delhi is reportedly working on super-fast charging tech that could juice up your EV faster than you can say "Bijlee"! Imagine, a full charge in the time it takes to grab a chai.
normalised: Meanwhile, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi is reportedly working on super-fast charging tech that could juice up your electric vehicle faster than you can say "Bijlee"! Imagine, a full charge in the time it takes to grab a chai.

unnormalised: Bharat Petroleum (BPCL) is also jumping into the game, setting up EV charging stations at their fuel pumps nationwide. Forget petrolheads, we're becoming electron-heads!
normalised: Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited is also jumping into the game, setting up electric vehicle charging stations at their fuel pumps nationwide. Forget petrolheads, we're becoming electron-heads!

unnormalised: There are still challenges, of course. Range anxiety is real, and the cost of charging can vary wildly. Plus, standardization of charging connectors is needed.
normalised: There are still challenges, of course. Range anxiety is real, and the cost of charging can vary wildly. Plus, standardization of charging connectors is needed.

unnormalised: But overall, the direction is clear: India is embracing EVs, and charging infrastructure is slowly but surely keeping pace.
normalised: But overall, the direction is clear: India is embracing electric vehicles, and charging infrastructure is slowly but surely keeping pace.

unnormalised: Soon, driving an EV will be as easy as hailing an auto-rickshaw! And maybe as common too. This Diwali, maybe gift your family a new EV, *agar batti* is old now!
normalised: Soon, driving an electric vehicle will be as easy as hailing an auto-rickshaw! And maybe as common too. This Diwali, maybe gift your family a new electric vehicle, *agar batti* is old now!
